analysis: NVD incorrectly reported a vulnerability that never existed. The function png_get_uint_31 has always contained validation against PNG_UINT_31_MAX.
evidence: Code analysis shows validation check present in libpng 1.6.36 (commit a40189cf8~1)
analysis: NVD incorrectly reported this as a NULL pointer dereference. The actual vulnerability was in certificate verification callback handling where multiple checks were not properly reported to the verification callback.
vulnerability_pattern: Multiple certificate checks collapsed into single callback invocation
fix_pattern: Added CHECK_CB macro to ensure each check invokes verification callback
recommendation: Update CVE description to reflect actual vulnerability type
vulnerability_pattern: Infinite loop when processing non-prime modulus values
fix_pattern: Changed while loop to bounded for loop with explicit termination
validation: Code analysis shows infinite loop replaced with bounded iteration
description: SMIME buffer overflow in ASN1 string handling due to incorrect memory allocation and NUL terminator writing
root_cause: The function allocated len bytes but wrote a NUL terminator at position len, causing a 1-byte heap overflow
fix_summary: Added conditional compilation flags to only add NUL terminator in fuzzing builds, and proper memory allocation handling
verification_method: Code analysis + patch comparison + manual review
